snippet: Opposition leaders in Azerbaijan said the arrests were politically motivated, and the United States Embassy in Baku, the capital, called for “transparency and fairness” in the investigation.
abstract: Authorities in Azerbaijan arrest two prominent opposition politicians and charge them with inciting riots in provincial city Ismayilli, which began after street fight and swelled into volatile three-day demonstration denouncing local officials.

byline.contributor: Shahla Sultanova contributed reporting from Baku, Azerbaijan.

lead_paragraph: Opposition leaders in Azerbaijan said the arrests were politically motivated, and the United States Embassy in Baku, the capital, called for “transparency and fairness” in the investigation.
